speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: SCENE V. Court before the same.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, KENT, and Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go you before to Gloucester with these letters.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Acquaint my daughter no further with any thing you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: know than comes from her demand out of the letter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If your diligence be not speedy, I shall be there afore you.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I will not sleep, my lord, till I have delivered

speaker: KENT
text_entry: your letter.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If a man's brains were in's heels, were't not in

speaker: Fool
text_entry: danger of kibes?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, boy.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then, I prithee, be merry; thy wit shall ne'er go

speaker: Fool
text_entry: slip-shod.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha, ha, ha!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Shalt see thy other daughter will use thee kindly;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: for though she's as like this as a crab's like an

speaker: Fool
text_entry: apple, yet I can tell what I can tell.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, what canst thou tell, my boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: She will taste as like this as a crab does to a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: crab. Thou canst tell why one's nose stands i'

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the middle on's face?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, to keep one's eyes of either side's nose; that

speaker: Fool
text_entry: what a man cannot smell out, he may spy into.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I did her wrong--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Canst tell how an oyster makes his shell?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nor I neither; but I can tell why a snail has a house.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, to put his head in; not to give it away to his

speaker: Fool
text_entry: daughters, and leave his horns without a case.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will forget my nature. So kind a father! Be my

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: horses ready?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thy asses are gone about 'em. The reason why the

speaker: Fool
text_entry: seven stars are no more than seven is a pretty reason.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Because they are not eight?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Yes, indeed: thou wouldst make a good fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To take 't again perforce! Monster ingratitude!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If thou wert my fool, nuncle, I'ld have thee beaten

speaker: Fool
text_entry: for being old before thy time.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How's that?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thou shouldst not have been old till thou hadst

speaker: Fool
text_entry: been wise.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, let me not be mad, not mad, sweet heaven

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Keep me in temper: I would not be mad!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter Gentleman

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now! are the horses ready?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Ready, my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come, boy.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: She that's a maid now, and laughs at my departure,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Shall not be a maid long, unless things be cut shorter.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Exeunt
